concept.title: Automatic Speech Recognition Data Handling Overview

conbody.p: This document provides an overview of Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) Data Handling.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: This library handles ASR recognition data.
The DLL that provides the functionality and the library to which your code must link is identified below.

entry.p: These files are used for implementing ASR Data Handling.

section.title: Architectural Relationship
section.p: ASR Data Handling is used by the ASR Client Utility to handle recognition matches. For more information, see Automatic Speech Recognition Client Utility Overview.

section.title: Description
section.p: The CSDClientResult class contains the results of a successful recognition match. The Grammar ID and Rule ID functions define the recognition match. The constructor returns an array of CSDClientResult classes. The first entry in the array is the best match.

section.title: Key ASR Data Handling Classes
section.p: The speech recognition functionality provided by ASR Data Handling is contained within the following key classes:

li.p: CSDClientResult - encapsulates a client recognition result.
CSDClientResultSet - encapsulates a client recogntion result set.
CSDRule - encapsulates a rule within a grammar.
CSDGrammar - encapsulates a set of rules.

section.title: Using ASR Data Handling
section.p: Clients can use ASR Data Handling to:

li.p: Return the number of CSDClientresult objects in the array.

p.xref: Automatic Speech Recognition Client Utility Overview
Automatic Speech Recognition Custom Commands Overview
